
# Working with Text in R

Text manipulation is a common task in data cleaning and reporting. R provides both base functions and packages like `stringr` and `glue`.

---

## Base R String Functions

### `paste0()`

Concatenates strings without spaces.

```r
paste0("Hello", "World")
# [1] "HelloWorld"
```

### `substr()`

Extracts or replaces substrings.

```r
Old_Text <- "Example"
New_Text <- substr(Old_Text, 1, 2)
New_Text
# [1] "Ex"
```

---

## Using the `stringr` Package

The `stringr` package (part of the tidyverse) provides consistent and easy-to-use string functions.

```r
library(stringr)

str_length("Hello")
# [1] 5
```

---

## Using the `glue` Package

The `glue` package allows for elegant string interpolation.

```r
library(glue)

name <- "Alice"
glue("Hello, {name}!")
# Hello, Alice!
```
